materials.title: Nouns & Pronouns: The Building Blocks
materials.content:
## 1. Nouns: Naming Your World
A **Noun** is a word that names a person, place, thing, or idea. 

### Common vs. Proper Nouns
*   **Common Nouns:** General things (city, man, phone, cat).
*   **Proper Nouns:** Specific names. They always start with a **Capital Letter** (London, Mr. Smith, iPhone, Saturday).

### Singular and Plural Nouns
*   **Singular (One):** A book, a desk, a child.
*   **Plural (More than one):** Two books, three desks, five children.
*   *Rule: Usually, we add '-s' to make a noun plural (Car → Cars).* 

## 2. Pronouns: Replacing the Names
**Pronouns** are short words we use so we don't have to repeat the same noun many times.

| Subject Pronoun | Possessive Adjective | Example Sentence |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **I** | **My** | I have a bag. It is **my** bag. |
| **You** | **Your** | You have a key. It is **your** key. |
| **He** | **His** | He has a dog. It is **his** dog. |
| **She** | **Her** | She has a car. It is **her** car. |
| **It** | **Its** | The cat has food. It is **its** food. |
| **We** | **Our** | We have a house. It is **our** house. |
| **They** | **Their** | They have books. They are **their** books. |

--- 

## Practice Conversations

### Sample Conversation 1: At the Office (2026 Tech Scene)
> **A:** Excuse me, is this **your** tablet? 
> **B:** No, it isn't. **I** have **my** tablet here in **my** backpack.
> **A:** Maybe it is **Sarah's**. **She** was here in the **office** earlier.
> **B:** You are right. **It** belongs to **her**. Let's call **her**.

### Sample Conversation 2: Meeting Neighbors
> **A:** Hi! **We** are the new **neighbors**. **Our** names are Tom and Lily.
> **B:** Welcome! **My** name is Marcus. Do **you** live in that **house**?
> **A:** Yes, **we** do. And this is **our** dog, Sparky.
> **B:** **He** is very friendly! **His** fur is so soft.

### Sample Conversation 3: Finding a Lost Phone
> **A:** Look! There is a **phone** on the **bench**. 
> **B:** Is it **your** phone, David?
> **A:** No, **my** phone is blue. That **phone** is black. 
> **B:** See those **people** over there? Maybe it is **their** phone.

### Sample Conversation 4: In the Classroom
> **Teacher:** Students, please take out **your** laptops.
> **Student:** Teacher, **I** can't find **my** laptop. 
> **Teacher:** Is it in **your** locker? 
> **Student:** Oh! **It** is under **my** chair. **I** am sorry!

### Sample Conversation 5: Shopping for Gifts
> **A:** I want to buy a **gift** for **my** mother. 
> **B:** Does **she** like **books**? 
> **A:** Yes, **she** loves **them**. **Her** favorite **writer** is Mark Twain.
> **B:** Look at this **book**. **Its** cover is beautiful. **She** will love it!

--- 

## Grammar Tip: Possessive 's
When we want to show that a **Noun** owns something, we add **'s**:
*   **The teacher's** pen. (The pen belongs to the teacher).
*   **John's** car. (The car belongs to John).
*   **My parents'** house. (The house belongs to my parents — *note: the ' is after the 's' for plurals*).
